Craft a Resume That Opens Doors

In today's competitive job market, a standard resume isn't enough. Most companies use Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) to filter candidates before a human ever sees your application. Our free resume builder is specifically designed to create resumes that pass these systems and get you noticed.

Combine your powerful resume with effective interview techniques to create a complete job search strategy that delivers results. We'll guide you through both processes with expert tips and proven strategies.

Essential Resume Writing Tips

Master these fundamental strategies to create a resume that gets you interviews

Tailor Your Resume for the Role

Carefully read the job description and mirror its keywords in your resume. This makes your application more relevant and helps it pass through Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS).

01

Quantify Your Achievements

Use numbers and metrics to demonstrate your impact. Instead of 'Responsible for sales,' write 'Increased sales by 25% over six months by implementing a new strategy.'

02

Use a Clean, Professional Format

Choose an ATS-friendly resume template with a clear font and logical sections. Avoid graphics and columns that can confuse automated systems.

03

Optimize Your Professional Summary

Write a powerful summary at the top of your resume that highlights your key skills and experiences relevant to the job you want.

04

Incorporate Relevant Keywords

Research common industry terms and skills for your target role. Sprinkling these keywords naturally throughout your resume improves its visibility.

05

Highlight Transferable Skills

Even if you're changing careers, focus on skills that are valuable across industries, like communication, project management, and problem-solving.

06

Proofread Meticulously

Typos and grammatical errors can get your resume rejected. Read it aloud, use spell check, and ask a friend to review it for you.

07

Save and Send in the Right Format

For most online applications, a PDF is best as it preserves your formatting. Ensure the file name is professional, like 'YourName_Resume.pdf'.

08

Advanced Resume Strategies

Take your resume to the next level with these expert techniques

Leverage Action Verbs

Start bullet points with powerful verbs like 'Orchestrated,' 'Engineered,' 'Launched,' or 'Analyzed' to make your experience sound more dynamic and results-oriented.

Prepare for Resume-Based Questions

Be ready to discuss every single point on your resume in detail. Interviewers will use it as a roadmap for their questions.

Align Resume and Online Profile

Ensure the experience and dates on your resume match your LinkedIn profile. Inconsistencies can raise red flags for employers.

Keep it Concise and Relevant

Aim for a one-page resume if you have under 10 years of experience. Prioritize recent and relevant roles, and trim older or unrelated positions.
